Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol.name: parent
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol.abstract: This is used to reference an “owning instance” of this instance, and it should be a CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol.name: id
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol.abstract: This returns a unique UUID String for the instance.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol.name: peripheral
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol.abstract: This casts the parent as a Peripheral Wrapper.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Writable.html#/s.name: id
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Writable.html#/s.abstract: REQUIRED: This returns a unique UUID String for the instance.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: handleError(_:from:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance to do whatever it needs to do to handle an error.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: updateFrom(_:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance to do whatever it needs to do to update its data.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManagerPoweredOn(_:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that the state of the Central manager just became “powered on.”

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:didConnectThisDevice:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a Peripheral device has been connected.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:willDisconnectThisDevice:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a peripheral device is about to be disconnected.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:deviceInfoChanged:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a Peripheral device has had some change.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:deviceReadyForWrite:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a Peripheral device is ready for a write.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:device:changedService:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a Service changed.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:device:service:characteristicWriteComplete:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a Characteristic write with response received its response.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:device:service:changedCharacteristicNotificationState:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a Characteristic changed its notification state.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:device:service:changedCharacteristic:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a Characteristic changed its value.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.name: centralManager(_:device:service:characteristic:changedDescriptor:)
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html#/s.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance that a Descriptor changed its value.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateDescr.name: updateThisDescriptor(_:)
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateDescr.abstract: This is called to inform an instance that a Descriptor downstream changed.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateChara.name: clear()
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateChara.abstract: This eliminates all of the stored data.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateChara.name: updateThisCharacteristic(_:)
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateChara.abstract: This is called to inform an instance that a Characteristic downstream changed.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateServi.name: updateThisService(_:)
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateServi.abstract: This is called to inform an instance that a Service downstream changed.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.name: parent
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.abstract: REQUIRED: This is used to reference an “owning instance” of this instance.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.name: central
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.abstract: REQUIRED: This is used to reference an “owning instance” of this instance.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.name: id
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.abstract: REQUIRED: This returns a unique UUID String for the instance.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.name: findEntityByUUIDString(_:)
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.abstract: OPTIONAL: This searches the hierarchy, and will return any instance that has an ID that matches the string passed in.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.name: handleError(_:)
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.abstract: OPTIONAL: This is called to tell the instance to do whatever it needs to do to handle an error.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.name: startOver()
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.abstract: OPTIONAL: Forces the instance to restart its discovery process.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.name: cbUUIDString
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html#/s:17R.abstract: OPTIONAL: This returns a unique UUID String for the Service or Characteristic, if this is a specialized class.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.name: id
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.abstract: This returns a unique UUID String for the instance.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.name: value
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.abstract: If the Descriptor has a value, it is returned here. It is completely untyped, as each descriptor has its own types.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.name: cbElementInstance
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.abstract: This holds the instance of CBDescriptor that is used by this instance.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.name: characteristic
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.abstract: This casts the parent as a Characteristic Wrapper.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.name: readValue()
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.abstract: The Peripheral is asked to read our value.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: id
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: This returns a unique UUID String for the instance.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: value
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: If the Characteristic has a value, it is returned here. It is a standard Data type.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: cbElementInstance
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: This holds the instance of CBDescriptor that is used by this instance.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: service
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: This casts the parent as a Service Wrapper.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: canWrite
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can write (eithe with or without response).

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: canWriteWithResponse
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can write, and returns a receipt response.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: canWriteWithoutResponse
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can write, and does not return a response.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: canRead
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can be read.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: canNotify
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can notify.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: canBroadcast
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can broadcast.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: canIndicate
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can indicate.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: isNotifying
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic is currently notifying.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: maximumWriteLength
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns the maximum number of bytes that can be written for this Peripheral.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: requiresAuthenticatedSignedWrites
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic requires authenticated writes.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: requiresNotifyEncryption
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic requires encrypted notification.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: requiresIndicateEncryption
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic requires encrypted indicates.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: hasExtendedProperties
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic has extension properties.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: extendedProperties
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: This will return any extension properties, as a simple tuple, or nil, if there are none.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: readValue()
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: The Peripheral is asked to read the value.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Protocol
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_P.abstract: This protocol publishes a public interface for our Characteristic wrapper classes.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Protocol
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Proto.abstract: This protocol publishes a public interface for our Descriptor wrapper classes.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html.name: CGA_Class_Protocol
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol.html.abstract: This protocol is the “base” protocol to which all the exposed types conform.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateServi.name: CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateService
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateServi.abstract: This protocol defines an interface for a message that indicates that a Service object needs to be refreshed.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateChara.name: CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateCharacteristic
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateChara.abstract: This protocol defines an interface for a message that indicates that a Characteristic object needs to be refreshed.

Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateDescr.name: CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateDescriptor
Protocols/CGA_Class_Protocol_UpdateDescr.abstract: This protocol defines an interface for a message that indicates that a Descriptor object needs to be refreshed.

Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html.name: CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate
Protocols/CGA_BlueThoth_Delegate.html.abstract: All delegate callbacks are made in the main thread.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Writable.html.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Writable
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Writable.html.abstract: This is a simple protocol for a basic writer.

Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol
Protocols/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Protocol.abstract: This protocol publishes a public interface for our Service wrapper classes.

Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.name: castInto(_:offsetInBytes:)
Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.abstract: This method allows a Data instance to be cast into various standard types.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its contained Peripheral (as the opaque type).

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its contained Peripheral

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its ID (String)

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: removeThisDevice(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Removes the element (as the opaque type).

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: contains(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Checks to see if the Array contains an instance that wraps the given CB element (as the opaque type).

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: contains(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Checks to see if the Array contains an instance that wraps the given CB element.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its UUID

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its contained Peripheral

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: characteristic(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Method that allows us to retrieve an Element by its contained Characteristic

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: contains(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Checks to see if the Array contains an instance that wraps the given CB element.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: removeThisDevice(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Removes the element (as a CBPeripheral).

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: indexOf(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Returns the first index of the submitted Peripheral warapper.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its UUID

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its contained Characteristic or CBService.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its UUID

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its contained Characteristic.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: removeThisCharacteristic(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Removes the element (as a CBCharacteristic).

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: contains(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Checks to see if the Array contains an instance that wraps the given CB element.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its UUID

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its contained Descriptor.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: contains(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Checks to see if the Array contains an instance that wraps the given CB element.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Special subscript that allows us to retrieve an Element by its contained Service

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: subscript(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: This subscript goes through our Services, looking for the one that “owns” the proferred Characteristic.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: characteristic(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: This method goes through the Services, looking for the one that “owns” the proferred Characteristic, and then returning the “wrapper” for the Characteristic.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: removeThisService(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Removes the element (as a CBService).

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.name: contains(_:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa17RVS_BlueTho.abstract: Checks to see if the Array contains an instance that wraps the given CB element.

Extensions/Array.html.name: Array
Extensions/Array.html.abstract: This allows us to fetch Peripherals in our staged Arrays, looking for an exact instance.

Extensions/Data.html.name: Data
Extensions/Data.html.abstract: This extension adds the ability to extract data from a Data instance, cast into various types.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: Simple equatable. We just compare the names, and not the contents.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: btUnavailable
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This indicates that the Bluetooth system is not available.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: unauthorized
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This indicates that the operation was not authenticated/authorized.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: timeoutError(_:)
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This indicates that a connection attempt timed out.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: unexpectedDisconnection(_:)
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This means that a Peripheral was unexpectedly disconnected.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: localizedDescription
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: Returns a localizable slug for the error. This does not include associated data.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: layeredDescription
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: Returns an Array, with Strings for any nested errors.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: associatedData
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This returns any associated data with the current status.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: returnNestedInternalErrorBasedOnThis(_:peripheral:)
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This returns an internal error, with the Peripheral that reported the error’s ID.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: returnNestedInternalErrorBasedOnThis(_:service:)
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This returns an internal error, with a nesting of the Bluetooth hierarchy that got us in this mess, and the Service’s ID.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: returnNestedInternalErrorBasedOnThis(_:characteristic:)
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This returns an internal error, with a nesting of the Bluetooth hierarchy that got us in this mess, and the Characteristic’s ID.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.name: returnNestedInternalErrorBasedOnThis(_:descriptor:)
Enums/CGA_Errors.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth.abstract: This returns an internal error, with a nesting of the Bluetooth hierarchy that got us in this mess, and the Descriptor’s ID.

Enums/CGA_Errors.html.name: CGA_Errors
Enums/CGA_Errors.html.abstract: This enumeration defines a powerful error reporting system for the Bluetooth framework. It conforms to the standard Error protocol.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: advertisementData
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This holds the advertisement data that came with the discovery.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: rssi
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This is the signal strength, at the time of discovery, in dBm.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: peripheralInstance
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This is the peripheral wrapper that is instantiated when the device is connected. It is nil, if the device is not connected. It is a strong reference.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: canSendWriteWithoutResponse
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: The Peripheral is capable of sending writes back (without response).

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: canConnect
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This is true, if the Peripheral advertisement data indicates the Peripheral can be connected.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: localName
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This is the “Local Name,” from the advertisement data.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: preferredName
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This is the local name, if available, or the Peripheral name, if the local name is not available.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: identifier
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: Returns the ID UUID as a String.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: isConnected
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: Returns true, if the peripheral is currently connected.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: ignore()
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This asks the Central Manager to ignore this device.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: unignore()
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This asks the Central Manager to “unignore” this device.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: connect()
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This asks the Central Manager to connect this device.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: disconnect()
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This asks the Central Manager to disconnect this device.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: advertisementData
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: This holds the raw advertisement data that came with the discovery.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: localName
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: Returns the local name, if provided. If not provided, will return an empty String.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: isConnectable
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: Returns true or false. True, if the Peripheral is connectable.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: transmitPowerLevel
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: Returns the transmit power level. Nil, if not provided.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: timestamp
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: Returns the timestamp, as a date. Nil, if not provided.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: hasPrimaryPHY
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: Returns true, if the Peripheral has a primary PHY.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: hasSecondaryPHY
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: Returns true, if the Peripheral has a secondary PHY.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: manufacturerData
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: Returns any manufacturer-specific data. Nil, if not provided.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html#.name: peripherals
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html#.abstract: This is a list of identifier UUIDs for specific Bluetooth devices.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html#.name: services
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html#.abstract: This is a list of UUIDs for Services that will be scanned.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html#.name: characteristics
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html#.abstract: This is a list of UUIDs for specific Characteristics to be discovered within Services.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html#.name: isEmpty
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html#.abstract: This returns true, if all of the specifiers are nil or empty.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: delegate
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: The Central Manager Delegate object.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: parent
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This is used to reference an “owning instance” of this instance, and it should be a CGA_Class_Protocol

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: isBTAvailable
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: Returns true, if the current state of the Bluetooth system is powered on.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: duplicateFilteringIsOn
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: If tue (default), then scanning is done with duplicate filtering on, which reduces the number of times the discovery callback is made.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: discoverOnlyConnectablePeripherals
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This Bool will be true, if we only want to discover devices that can be connected. Default is false.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: allowEmptyNames
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This Bool will be true, if we will allow devices that don’t broadcast names to be discovered. Default is false.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: minimumRSSILevelIndBm
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This is a “Minimum RSSI Level” for filtering. If a device is discovered with an RSSI less than this, it is ignored.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: stagedBLEPeripherals
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This will hold BLE Peripherals, as they are being “loaded.” Once they are “complete,” they go into the main collection, wrapped in our class.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: ignoredBLEPeripherals
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This will hold BLE Peripherals that have been marked as “ignored.”

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: scanCriteria
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This will contain any required scan criteria.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: Element
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: We aggregate Peripherals.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: sequence_contents
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This holds our cached Array of Peripheral instances.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: isScanning
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This is the indicator as to whether or not the Bluetooth subsystem is actiively scanning for Peripherals.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: init(sequence_contents:)
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: The required init, with a “primed” sequence.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: reportError(_:)
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: Called to report an error.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: init(delegate:scanCriteria:queue:)
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This is the init that should always be used.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: startScanning(withServices:duplicateFilteringIsOn:)
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: Asks the Central Manager to start scanning for Peripherals.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: restartScanning()
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: Asks the Central Manager to start scanning for Peripherals, but reuse any saved filters (as opposed to supplying them).

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: stopScanning()
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: Asks the Central Manager to stop scanning for Peripherals.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: startOver(_:)
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This eliminates all of the stored results, and asks the Bluetooth subsystem to start over from scratch.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: disconnectAllPeripherals()
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This forces disconnects for all Peripherals.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: connect(_:)
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: Called to initiate a connection (and discovery process) with the peripheral.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: disconnect(_:)
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: Called to terminate a connection with the peripheral.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.name: findEntityByUUIDString(_:)
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html#/s:17RVS_Blue.abstract: This searches the hierarchy, and will return any instance that has an ID that matches the string passed in.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html.name: ScanCriteria
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/ScanCriteria.html.abstract: This is the struct that we use to narrow the search criteria for new instances of the CGA_Bluetooth_CentralManager class.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..name: AdvertisementData
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/AdvertisementData..abstract: This struct allows us to apply some data interpretation to the advertisement data.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.name: DiscoveryData
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth/DiscoveryData.html.abstract: This is a class, as opposed to a struct, because I want to make sure that it is referenced, and not copied.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_DeviceInfo.name: manufacturerName
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_DeviceInfo.abstract: This returns The manufacturer name for the Service (if provided).

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_DeviceInfo.name: modelNumber
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_DeviceInfo.abstract: This returns The model number for the Service (if provided).

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Battery.ht.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service_Battery.ht.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Service.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.name: sequence_contents
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.abstract: This is our main cache Array. It contains wrapped instances of our aggregate CB type.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.name: parent
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.abstract: This is used to reference an “owning instance” of this instance, and it should be a CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.name: id
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.abstract: This returns a unique UUID String for the instance.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.name: peripheral
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.abstract: This casts the parent as a Peripheral Wrapper.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.name: clear()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.abstract: This eliminates all of the stored and staged results.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.name: startOver()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.abstract: This eliminates all of the stored results, and asks the Bluetooth subsystem to start over from scratch.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.name: findEntityByUUIDString(_:)
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html#/s:17.abstract: This searches the hierarchy, and will return any instance that has an ID that matches the string passed in.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: sequence_contents
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This is our main cache Array. It contains wrapped instances of our aggregate CB type.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: parent
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This is used to reference an “owning instance” of this instance, and it should be a CGA_Bluetooth_Parent instance.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: discoveryData
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This holds the discovery data that applies to this instance.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: isConnected
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: Returns true, if we are currently connected.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: canSendWriteWithoutResponse
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: The Peripheral is capable of sending writes back (without response).

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: rssi
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This is the signal strength, at the time of discovery, in dBm.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: scanCriteria
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This will contain any required scan criteria. It simply passes on the Central criteria.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: id
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This returns a unique UUID String for the instance.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: connect()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: Forces a connect. If already connected, nothing happens.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: disconnect()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: Forces a disconnect. If not connected, nothing happens.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: startOver()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This eliminates all of the stored results, and asks the Bluetooth subsystem to start over from scratch.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: clear()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This eliminates all of the stored and staged results.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.name: findEntityByUUIDString(_:)
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html#/s.abstract: This searches the hierarchy, and will return any instance that has an ID that matches the string passed in.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: value
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: If the Descriptor has a value, it is returned here. It is completely untyped, as each descriptor has its own types.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: dataValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: This attempts to cast the value of the Descriptor into a Data object.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: stringValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: If the Descriptor has a value, and that value can be expressed as a String, it is returned here.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: intValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: Returns the number (if possible) as an Int64. This assumes littlendian.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: uInt8Value
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: Returns the number (if possible) as a UInt8.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: uInt16Value
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: Returns the number (if possible) as a UInt16.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: uInt32Value
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: Returns the number (if possible) as a UInt32.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: uInt64Value
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: Returns the number (if possible) as a UInt64.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: boolValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: Returns the value as a Boolean. It should be noted that ANY non-zero number will return true.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: id
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: This returns a unique UUID String for the instance.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: cbElementInstance
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: This holds the instance of CBDescriptor that is used by this instance.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: readValue()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: The Peripheral is asked to read our value.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: writeValue(_:)
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: The Peripheral is asked to write the given data into its value.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: parent
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: This is used to reference an “owning instance” of this instance, and it should be a CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.name: characteristic
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html#/s.abstract: This casts the parent as a Characteristic Wrapper.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Sys.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Sys.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Sof.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Sof.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Ser.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Ser.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Mod.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Mod.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Man.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Man.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Loc.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Loc.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Fir.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Fir.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Cur.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Cur.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Bat.name: uuid
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Bat.abstract: This returns a unique GATT UUID String for the Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: Element
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This is the type we’re aggregating. We aggregate the public face of the Descriptors.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: sequence_contents
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This is our main cache Array. It contains wrapped instances of our aggregate CB type.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: concatenateValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: If this is set to true, then new data (value) will be appended to existing data.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: parent
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This is used to reference an “owning instance” of this instance, and it should be a CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: cbElementInstance
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This holds the instance of CBCharacteristic that is used by this instance.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: id
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: The UUID of this Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: canWrite
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can write (eithe with or without response).

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: canWriteWithResponse
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can write, and returns a receipt response.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: canWriteWithoutResponse
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can write, and does not return a response.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: canRead
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can be read.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: canNotify
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can notify.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: canBroadcast
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can broadcast.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: canIndicate
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic can indicate.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: isNotifying
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic is currently notifying.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: maximumWriteLength
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns the maximum number of bytes that can be written for this Peripheral.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: requiresAuthenticatedSignedWrites
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic requires authenticated writes.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: requiresNotifyEncryption
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic requires encrypted notification.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: requiresIndicateEncryption
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic requires encrypted indicates.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: hasExtendedProperties
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns true, if the Characteristic has extension properties.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: stringValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: If the Characteristic has a value, and that value can be expressed as a String, it is returned here.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: intValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns the number (if possible) as an Int64. This assumes littlendian.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: boolValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns the value as a Boolean. It should be noted that ANY non-zero number will return true.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: doubleValue
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Returns the value as a Double.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: extendedProperties
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This will return any extension properties, as a simple tuple, or nil, if there are none.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: value
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: If the Characteristic has a value, it is returned here.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: central
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This returns the parent Central Manager

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: readValue()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: If we have read permission, the Peripheral is asked to read our value.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: startNotifying()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Tells the Peripheral to start notifying on this Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: stopNotifying()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: Tells the Peripheral to stop notifying on this Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: clearConcatenate(newValue:)
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This clears the concatenated value.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: init(sequence_contents:)
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: The required init, with a “primed” sequence.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: writeValue(_:withResponseIfPossible:)
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: If we have write permission, the Peripheral is asked to write the given data into its value.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: writeValue(_:)
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: If we have write permission, the Peripheral is asked to write the given data into its value. It will avoid responsibility.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: clear()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This eliminates all of the stored Descriptors.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: startOver()
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This eliminates all of the stored results, and asks the Bluetooth subsystem to start over from scratch.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: service
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This casts the parent as a Service Wrapper.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: findEntityByUUIDString(_:)
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This searches the hierarchy, and will return any instance that has an ID that matches the string passed in.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic.htm.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of CBCharacteristic, adding some functionality, and linking the hierarchy.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Bat.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_BatteryLevel
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Bat.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Battery Level Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Cur.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_CurrentTime
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Cur.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Current Time Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Fir.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_FirmwareRevision
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Fir.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Firmware Revision Characteristic.

Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS45CGA.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_HardwareRevision
Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS45CGA.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Hardware Revision Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Loc.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_LocalTimeInformation
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Loc.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Local Time Information Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Man.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_ManufacturerName
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Man.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Manufacturer Name Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Mod.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_ModelNumber
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Mod.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Model Number Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Ser.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_SerialNumber
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Ser.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Serial Number Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Sof.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_SoftwareRevision
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Sof.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the Software Revision Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Sys.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_SystemID
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Characteristic_Sys.abstract: This adds a specialized accessor to the System ID Characteristic.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor.html.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of CBDescriptor, adding some functionality, and linking the hierarchy.

Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS40CGA.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_AggregateFormat
Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS40CGA.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of The Characteristic Aggregate Format CBDescriptor.

Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS53CGA.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_CBUUIDL2CAPPSMCharacteristic
Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS53CGA.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of The L2CAP Channel PSM CBDescriptor.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Charact.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Characteristic_Extended_Properties
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Charact.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of The Characteristic Extended Properties CBDescriptor, adding some functionality, and linking the hierarchy.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_ClientC.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_ClientCharacteristicConfiguration
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_ClientC.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of The Client Characteristic Configuration CBDescriptor, adding some functionality, and linking the hierarchy.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Present.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_PresentationFormat
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_Present.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of The User Description CBDescriptor.

Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS58CGA.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_ServerCharacteristicConfiguration
Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS58CGA.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of The Server Characteristic Configuration CBDescriptor.

Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS40CGA.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Descriptor_UserDescription
Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BlueThoth_iOS40CGA.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of The User Description CBDescriptor.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Peripheral.html.abstract: This class is instantiated when a Peripheral is connected, and will handle discovery of Services, Characteristics and Descriptors.

Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html.name: CGA_Bluetooth_Service
Classes/CGA_Bluetooth_Service.html.abstract: This class “wraps” instances of CBService, adding some functionality, and linking the hierarchy.

Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html.name: RVS_BlueThoth
Classes/RVS_BlueThoth.html.abstract: This is the main class that is instantiated in order to implement the Bluetooth subsystem.
